Midas Documentation » SECTION 5: Run Control » Run Control Programs » mhttpd: the MIDAS Web-based Run Control utility

Programs page



The Programs page is displayed by clicking on the Programs Button ( if present) on the Main Status Page .

This page presents the current active list of the clients attached to the given experiment. On the right hand side, a dedicated button allows the user to stop a particular client. This is equivalent to the ODBedit shutdown command. For example, pressing the "stop Speaker" button (see example below) would be equivalent to 

odbedit> sh Speaker

Clicking the client name hyperlink (on the left hand side of the page) pops up a new window pointing to the ODB /Programs subdirectory related to that particular client (see The ODB /Programs tree). Example 1 shows the Programs page with a number of clients running. The hyperlink for the client ltnoRC has been clicked, and the popup window shows the ODB path /Programs/ltnoRC.




Example 1: mhttpd Programs page.





The ODB structure for each client should be customized by the user (see Customize the ODB /Programs tree ).

Note:
The buttons and other information that appears on the Programs mhttpd page depends on the settings of the fields of the /Programs/<client > subdirectory.

Example 2 shows the case where mlogger is running, but is not Required (i.e. /Programs/logger/required is false). When mlogger is stopped by pressing the key "Stop Logger" on the Programs page, the Logger program is no longer displayed. This is because clients which are not Required are not shown in the Programs page unless they are running.




Example 2: Programs page - mlogger utility is not Required





In Example 3, mlogger's Required flag has been set true. In this case, when mlogger is stopped the line for the Logger program is retained. Because a Start Command has been supplied, the "Start Logger" button is displayed. Pressing this will cause the Start Command to be issued, and mlogger should start. The /Programs/< client > tree also provides for a client to be automatically started or restarted.

Note that an Alarm Class has also been supplied, giving rise to the Alarm banner on the main status page. See MIDAS Alarm System for details.




Example 3: Programs page - mlogger utility is Required and an alarm class has been specified
